emuInput.TitMainTitle: Group portrait of artists William Palmer, Mrs. C. McKenzie Lewis, Thaddeus "Thad" Mosley, Mrs. John K. Tabor, Mrs. David M. Weill, and Mrs. Robert Freeman, posed with sculpture at Three Rivers Arts Festival, Gateway Center, Downtown
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 3, 1961, pg. 7, reads: "Art Festival Participants - Thousands are expected to attend the colorful and entertaining Pittsburgh Arts Festival, at the Gateway Center, June 2-7, daily until 10 P.M. The magnificent exhibit is being presenting by the Arts Festival Committee of Carnegie Institute. Admission is free.  Featured will be a symphony orchestra, painting, crafts, soloists, jazz, theatre, sculpture, architecture and folk singing.  Among the participants will be, left to right, front row: William Palmer, sculpture; Thaddeus Mosley, sculpture; Mrs. David M. Weill, exhibiting artist, who also will be in charge of arts and crafts demonstrations at the festival, and Mrs. Robert Freeman, program chairman of Music and Arts Club of Pittsburgh, and a Volunteers Day captain for the festival, on June 2 (opening night).  Back row: Mrs. C. McKenzie Lewis of the art exhibit committee and Mrs. John K. Tabor, chairman of the exhibit. - Harris Photo."
